website_summaries.verdict: Neolab's N2 is an ergonomically friendly and surprisingly precise.
pros: This smart pen model can save handwriting in multiple formats, including PDF, JPG, and SVG
Its form is similar to an actual ink pen, and is therefore easy to hold for a longer period of time
The N professional notebook (not included) makes it easy to sort handwritten notes sequentially
cons: Only works with the N professional notebook
Some users have complained about ink quality

customer_reviews.title: This pen is a lot better than the live scribe
customer_reviews.text: This pen is a lot better than the live scribe. Form factor is perfect. When I write with it at school it look like a normal pen. Actually it's a little triangular and fits better between fingers than even traditional pens... I only wish the iOS App was updated more frequently than couple times a year. Also automated iCloud syncing feature is missing, so after using iPhone for a few days, I can't seamlessly open the same app on iPad and continue writing. I'd absolutely recommend this pen to everyone and hope the company in South Korea grows bigger and continues innovation.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: I love my Neo Smarpen
customer_reviews.text: I love my Neo Smarpen! I am often in meetings where it is not convenient to have my laptop out for notes. I love that the notes I jot down are with me on my phone at all times, so even if I don't have my notebook, my notes are still available. I have used the notebooks and printed out the paper for use as well. I was concerned about the size of the pen, I do not like "fat" pens, but due to the rounded triangular shape it feels like a regular sized pen when writing. I did quite a bit of research before purchasing and am more than pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Turnip

customer_reviews.title: I've found the Neo smartpen N2 to be very useful for keeping track of notes
customer_reviews.text: I've found the Neo smartpen N2 to be very useful for keeping track of notes. In my experience it tracks near flawlessly and has never missed any of my writing or drawing. However, I have had others try it and found a few people that write at an angle ( pen to notebook rotation in the up axis ) that causes the smartpen not to track. The issue was resolved by rotating the notebook so that it was oriented to their hand/arm and not their body.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Silvey III

customer_reviews.title: Love the NEO Smartpen!
customer_reviews.text: YES! Finally, I have found a suitable replacement for the edefective Livescribe WifI pen, (display burnout on 3 pens). The NEO looks, feels and performs better than the Livescribe. Setup is super easy. Syncing is slow to both the app and to Evernote, but it DOES work. I'm so happy with my NEO smartpen purchase. I cannot say enough good signs about it.
customer_reviews.author: rob damiani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pen, worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this pen on an off for 1 yr and I love it. There are some flaws with the product but they are slowly getting fixed. I use this for school and sketching. Good investment for those who prefer to take handwritten notes and also need to transcribe into digital.
customer_reviews.author: Eder

customer_reviews.title: Good pen, no free professional notebook received with order
customer_reviews.text: I love the pen. Works great for what I need it for. Like other reviews, I was supposed to receive the professional notebook free with my order. I DIDN'T get it. Seems to be a frequent happening according to other reviews. You have to go online to neo to get a more detailed operating manual and even then it isn't that detailed, but better than what comes with the pen.
customer_reviews.author: Jinx L. Heath Finch

customer_reviews.title: Useability
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Minor annoyances, e.g. at times pen struggles to switch off; would have loved local support in South Africa to assist with issues and supply. Writes and feels natural, the ability to print your own paper makes this a winner in my books. A few improvements would set this apart from all other options: AI handwritting learning; selectable translation to eliminate translation of pictures, call-outs, etc to words; Automatic classification of notes based on tags, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ddt

customer_reviews.title: Great for notes in multiple locations
customer_reviews.text: I just received today. Used with the paper I printed off my computer. For my uses, it is exactly what I wanted. Now, if the 2018 planner I ordered ever arrives, & works, as I hope...this will be a perfect system!
customer_reviews.author: Tome Hills

customer_reviews.title: Neo vs Livescribe ... No contest, winner is Neo
customer_reviews.text: Ex Livescribe user, not going back. Was on 3rd pen, 2 of the SkiWiFi and dealing with 2nd "dimming display and out of warranty" so looking for a new solution. Found it the Neo, so far loving it. Syncing with Evernote and one happy camper. With "near time" display on my phone of what I am writing so I am able to see if pen has timed out and turned off in real time and turn pen back on instead of finding out much later with dimmed out display that Livescribe had not been recording my work for possibly hours...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Smartpen!
customer_reviews.text: This pen has great handwriting recognition and is light. The associated Android app also works well. Great pen!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great pen, sub par paper.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is super cool. Much easier to hold than my old Livescribe. Writes smooth, connects fast, and just works. However, so far my experience with the over-priced notebooks is that they are basically poorly bound tissue paper. Great pen, but they need to really step it up on the paper.
customer_reviews.author: gary m singer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed smart pen but needs Windows software to synch on desktop ...
customer_reviews.text: Well designed smart pen but needs Windows software to synch on desktop to be what I need. Desktop search not tablet and Evernote are not the best solutions. The Livescribe desktop search without needing to transcribe was VERY useful but their software has gotten worse as well. In sum, old Livescribe desktop software with the Ned smartpen would be a great complete solution.
customer_reviews.author: RMSCHUYLER

customer_reviews.title: It is a silent revolution in note taking and organizing - highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: It is a great idea. Everything you right is automatically digitized and even converted into text (some quality control necessary). The softare is very simple and powerful. I use this pen a lot and highly recommend it. I hope that with the next version they will make it somewhat smaller, with a better grip and lighter. This is not to say that these are problems. I would have sent the pen back if they were. But when I right for a coue of hours it becomes aparent that as with any stylish pen, more could be done to make it the best in the writing tool category.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Kindle

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, but some bumps along the road
customer_reviews.text: Week 1 review: Pen: slick, slim, well done; I was successfully able to change the ink color to blue with a different Zebra refill and have my text scan. App: poor english, ok work flow. Seemingly no way to back up transcribed pages as text; No way to edit errors in transcription. App instructions disagree with paper wrapper instructions with poor english(?) Paper: no college ruled (7 mm) paper available (my favorite). Overall: App updates VERY fast with fast and accurate transcription. More to come

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Major disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave reviews but I just had to for this one. I'm an applied physics PhD student and my notes normally contain a ton of equations and graphs, and this pen missed literally more than half my strokes. If I wrote very slowly with nice and pretty handwriting and no equations, it worked okay-ish. Other than that, it was garbage. Not really useful for any actual note taking as a student.

customer_reviews.text: Not reliable for me at all.... The digitization was stopping in the middle of sentences or writing. Nothing more frustrating than, after an hour meeting, discovering only the first 2 sentences were captured. I tried 2 different notebooks and changing settings. Same issue. I just returned the product. It could have been a defective product as I seemed could find a similar issue in the reviews or forums.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING PRODUCT, SOMETHING I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR... FOR A LONG TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Ghas

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the N2 and absolutely love it. Having previously used Livescribe, it is a real step forward in many ways. Firstly, the size of the pen is much more "normal". I always found the Livescribe too bulky and, frankly, a little embarrassing to use in public. But the N2 is thinner and smaller and looks and feels just like a regular pen. Also, the bluetooth interface that automatically transfers notes without having to connect a cable is by far the best part. It works seamlessly. Finally, the integration with Evernote is also a huge plus. Obviously, as this product develops, more features will become available. But I think, even now, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Eastwood

product_meta.title: NEO SMARTPEN N2 Bluetooth Digital Pen Compatible with iOS, Android, Smartphones, Tablets, and Windows PC (Titan Black)
feature_bullets: DIGITIZE YOUR NOTES - The Neo Smartpen N2 has an internal camera that captures your handwritten texts and converts them to digital documents when the pen syncs with Neo Notes app.
CAPTURES EVERY STROKE - It is equipped with Dual-Core ARM9 Processor, so it records more than 120 FPS (frames per second) and can calculate up to 256 steps of pressure.
WRITE NOW, SYNC LATER – The digital pen has 90MB of internal storage so you can transfer your stored handwriting data at a later time. NOTE: Refrain from writing during pen data transmission.

COMPATIBILITY - You can export your lectures and drawings with various social media platforms. The companion app, Neo Notes, is compatible with Evernote, Google Drive Manager, OneNote, and Creative Cloud.

OFFERS A REPLACEABLE INK CARTRIDGE - The Neo Smartpen uses Standard D1-Type pen tip, and you can always replace it with D1 refills. Please check NeoLAB's page for the full list of compatible ink refills.
